title: Where to Find Alzheimer's Resources
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: Looking for more information on Alzheimer's disease? There are many organizations that can tell you more about the condition and offer support for those who have it. Check out these groups to find what you need.
Alzheimer's Association 800-272-3900 Email: [email protected]
Alzheimer's and related Dementias Education and Referral Center (ADEAR) 800-438-4380 Email: [email protected]
Alzheimer's Foundation of America 866-232-8484 Email: [email protected]
Alzheimer's Disease International +44 20 7981 0880 (phone) Email: [email protected]
BrightFocus Foundation 800-437-2423 Email: [email protected]
American Psychiatric Association 202-559-3900 Email: [email protected]
The Cognitive Neurology and Alzheimer's Disease Center 312-908-9339
Family Caregiver Alliance 800-445-8106 Email: [email protected]
National Council on Aging 571-527-3900 Eldercare Locator: 800-677-1116
Caregiver Action Network 855-227-3640
National Institute on Aging 800-222-2225 TTY: 800-222-4225 Email: [email protected]
National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke 800-352-9424 TTY: 301-496-5751
Administration for Community Living 202-401-4634 Email: [email protected]
